intro: Brachystelma ringens, commonly known as the red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant produces striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its fleshy stems and leaves are adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Brachystelma ringens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry climates.
